task.title: Understand Function Declaration vs Expression
task.problemStatement: Learn the differences between function declarations and function expressions, including hoisting behavior and use cases.
task.expectedOutput: Correctly identify and use both function declaration and expression patterns

challenges.title: Convert Declaration to Expression
challenges.description: Convert a given function declaration into a function expression. Ensure both versions produce the same output.

challenges.title: Compare Hoisting Behavior
challenges.description: Demonstrate the hoisting difference by calling functions before their definition. Show why declarations work but expressions don't.

challenges.title: Named Function Expression
challenges.description: Create a named function expression and use recursion to show how named expressions can reference themselves.

task.title: Master Hoisting in JavaScript
task.problemStatement: Understand how JavaScript hoisting works for variables and functions, and predict the behavior of code with hoisting.
task.expectedOutput: Correctly predict hoisting behavior and avoid common pitfalls

challenges.title: Variable Hoisting with var
challenges.description: Demonstrate var hoisting by accessing a variable before its declaration. Show that it returns undefined, not an error.

challenges.title: Function Hoisting
challenges.description: Call a function before its declaration and show that it works correctly due to hoisting.

challenges.title: Temporal Dead Zone with let/const
challenges.description: Explain why accessing let/const before declaration throws ReferenceError (Temporal Dead Zone). Compare with var hoisting.

task.title: Create and Use IIFE
task.problemStatement: Learn to create and use Immediately Invoked Function Expressions (IIFE) to create private scopes and avoid global pollution.
task.expectedOutput: IIFE patterns that create private scopes and execute immediately

challenges.title: Create Basic IIFE
challenges.description: Write an IIFE that executes immediately and logs a message without creating global variables.

challenges.title: IIFE with Parameters
challenges.description: Create an IIFE that accepts parameters and returns a value. Show how to pass arguments to an immediately invoked function.

challenges.title: Module Pattern with IIFE
challenges.description: Use IIFE to create a module with private variables and public methods. Demonstrate encapsulation.

task.title: Work with Function Arguments
task.problemStatement: Understand how to access and manipulate function arguments using the arguments object and modern approaches.
task.expectedOutput: Properly handle multiple and variable function arguments

challenges.title: Access Arguments Object
challenges.description: Create a function that accepts variable number of arguments and uses the arguments object to sum them.

challenges.title: Arguments vs Parameters
challenges.description: Demonstrate the difference between function parameters (defined in declaration) and arguments (passed at call time).

challenges.title: Convert Arguments to Array
challenges.description: Show multiple ways to convert the arguments object into an array (Array.from(), spread operator, Array.prototype.slice).

task.title: Master Rest Operator
task.problemStatement: Learn to use the rest operator (...) to collect multiple arguments into an array parameter.
task.expectedOutput: Functions using rest parameters to handle variable arguments elegantly

challenges.title: Rest Parameters in Function
challenges.description: Create a function that uses rest parameters (...) to accept multiple arguments and process them as an array.

challenges.title: Rest with Regular Parameters
challenges.description: Combine regular parameters with rest parameters. Show that rest must be the last parameter.

challenges.title: Rest in Destructuring
challenges.description: Use rest operator in destructuring assignment to capture remaining elements from arrays or object properties.

task.title: Use Default Parameters
task.problemStatement: Learn to set default parameter values in functions to handle missing or undefined arguments.
task.expectedOutput: Functions with sensible default values for optional parameters

challenges.title: Basic Default Parameters
challenges.description: Create a function with default parameter values. Show how they're used when arguments are not provided.

challenges.title: Default with Expressions
challenges.description: Use complex expressions or function calls as default parameter values.

challenges.title: Default Parameters with Objects
challenges.description: Set default values for object destructured parameters. Create functions that accept configuration objects with defaults.

task.title: Implement Getters and Setters
task.problemStatement: Learn to use getter and setter methods to control access to object properties with validation and encapsulation.
task.expectedOutput: Objects with controlled property access through getters and setters

challenges.title: Create Basic Getter
challenges.description: Create an object with a getter that computes a value on-the-fly without storing it as a property.

challenges.title: Setter with Validation
challenges.description: Implement a setter that validates input before assigning it to a property. Throw an error for invalid values.

challenges.title: Encapsulation with Private Variables
challenges.description: Use getters and setters to create private variables with controlled access. Prevent direct modification.

task.title: Handle Errors with Try-Catch
task.problemStatement: Learn to use try-catch-finally blocks to handle errors gracefully and throw custom errors.
task.expectedOutput: Programs that gracefully handle errors and provide meaningful error messages

challenges.title: Basic Try-Catch
challenges.description: Write code with try-catch blocks to handle potential errors without crashing the program.

challenges.title: Throw Custom Errors
challenges.description: Create and throw custom error messages. Catch specific error types and handle them appropriately.

challenges.title: Finally Block Usage
challenges.description: Implement try-catch-finally to ensure cleanup code runs regardless of whether an error occurred.

task.title: Understand JavaScript Scopes
task.problemStatement: Learn about global scope, local scope, function scope, and block scope in JavaScript.
task.expectedOutput: Code demonstrating proper scope usage and avoiding global scope pollution

challenges.title: Global vs Local Variables
challenges.description: Demonstrate the difference between global and local variables. Show scope shadowing when local and global variables have the same name.

challenges.title: Function Scope
challenges.description: Create nested functions to show how inner functions access variables from outer scopes (lexical scoping).

challenges.title: Block Scope with let and const
challenges.description: Show that let and const have block scope (inside if/for blocks), while var has function scope.

task.title: Compare var, let, and const
task.problemStatement: Understand the differences between var, let, and const in terms of scope, hoisting, and reassignment.
task.expectedOutput: Code using appropriate variable declarations for different scenarios

challenges.title: var Function Scope vs let Block Scope
challenges.description: Demonstrate that var is function-scoped while let is block-scoped. Show loops where this difference matters.

challenges.title: Hoisting Differences
challenges.description: Compare hoisting behavior of var, let, and const. Show undefined initialization vs Temporal Dead Zone.

challenges.title: Const vs let
challenges.description: Explain const immutability for reassignment but not for object/array mutations. Show best practices.

task.title: Master the this Keyword
task.problemStatement: Understand how this keyword works in different contexts (function, method, constructor, arrow function).
task.expectedOutput: Proper use of this keyword in various JavaScript contexts

challenges.title: this in Method vs Function
challenges.description: Show how this refers to the object when called as a method, but to the global object (or undefined in strict mode) in a regular function.

challenges.title: this in Constructor
challenges.description: Create a constructor function where this refers to the newly created object instance.

challenges.title: Arrow Functions and this Binding
challenges.description: Show that arrow functions don't have their own this, but inherit it from the surrounding scope. Compare with regular functions.

task.title: Control this Binding
task.problemStatement: Learn to use call(), apply(), and bind() to explicitly set the this context when calling functions.
task.expectedOutput: Correct use of call, apply, and bind for explicit this control

challenges.title: Using call() and apply()
challenges.description: Use call() and apply() to explicitly set this context. Show the difference between passing single vs multiple arguments.

challenges.title: bind() for Permanent this
challenges.description: Use bind() to create a new function with a permanently bound this context. Show use in event listeners and callbacks.

challenges.title: Practical this Patterns
challenges.description: Implement common patterns like method borrowing, chaining, and fixing this loss in callbacks.

task.title: JavaScript Mastery Summary
task.problemStatement: Review and consolidate all JavaScript concepts learned throughout the course.
task.expectedOutput: Understanding of complete JavaScript fundamentals and advanced concepts

challenges.title: Review: Build a Utility Function Library
challenges.description: Create a collection of utility functions using various JavaScript concepts learned (closures, arrow functions, default parameters, etc.)

challenges.title: Mini Project: Simple OOP Application
challenges.description: Build a mini application using objects, constructors, getters/setters, error handling, and proper this binding.

challenges.title: Code Review Challenge
challenges.description: Review sample code with common mistakes and refactor it using best practices from the entire course.
